data.description: Continuation of introductory instruction in aural skills.
data.title: MUSICA PRACTICA: AURAL SKILLS 2

data.description: Continuation of strategies for composing, understanding, and writing about music.
data.title: MUSICA PRACTICA 2

data.description: Introduction to the applied theory of functional tonal and modal jazz harmony; analysis of song forms from the standard jazz repertoire; study of reharmonization techniques, chord substitution, and types of chord voicings; principles of melodic writing and motivic development, jazz counterpoint, and voice-leading considerations; and writing for common instruments in jazz ensembles. Students will analyze compositions from the standard jazz repertoire and apply the principles studied to create their own compositions for small jazz ensemble.
data.title: JAZZ THEORY & COMPOSITION

data.description: Strategies for composing, understanding, and writing about music.
data.title: MUSICA PRACTICA 1
